title: cryptographically verify
extract: A cryptographic checksum is a mathematical value (called a checksum) that is assigned to a file and used to "test" the file at a later date to verify that the data contained in the file has not been maliciously changed. ... Cryptographic checksums are used in data transmission and data storage.
